intro: Carum olympicum, commonly known as the Olympic caraway, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Greece. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes other aromatic herbs like parsley and dill. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and have a subtle, spicy aroma. Carum olympicum is often found in rocky or gravelly soils at higher elevations.
